title: ICE for perform_test in pattern matching checking

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Modified code from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/109188#issuecomment-1473047671, ### Code ```Rust enum Either { One(X), Two(X), } struct X; fn move_into_fnmut() { let x = Either::One(X); let y = || { let Either::Two(a) = x; }; } fn main() { } ``` Only crash with the option `--edition 2021`: ```console rustc --edition 2021 ./p/debug3.rs ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (da7c50c08 2023-03-19) ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/build/expr/as_place.rs:258:31 stack backtrace: 0: 0x100b585f8 - ::fmt::hee0b2bdff53fbe2f 1: 0x100bab3e4 -
